translated: If the consonant remains as it is, but is repeated by the vowel as its companion, due to being joined at the end, it is only antya-anu-prāsa.

analyzed: śabda arthayoḥ paunaruktyam bhavet tātparya mātrataḥ
translated: There would be repetition of sound and meaning only by implication.

analyzed: lāṭānuprāsaḥ iti uktaḥ nuprāsaḥ pañcadhā mataḥ
translated: Anuprāsa is said to be of five kinds, called lāṭānuprāsa.

analyzed: sati arthe pṛthak arthāyāḥ svara vyañjana santateḥ
translated: When there is a sequence of vowels and consonants with a different meaning,

analyzed: krameṇa tena eva āvṛttiḥ yamakam vinigadyate
translated: if there is repetition of that very sequence, it is called yamaka.

analyzed: anyasya anya arthakam vākyam anyathā yojayet yadi
translated: If one were to connect a sentence with a different meaning in a different way,

original: anyaḥ śleṣeṇa kākvā vā sā vakroktis tato dvidhā // / //
analyzed: anyaḥ śleṣeṇa kākvā vā sā vakroktiḥ tatas dvidhā
translated: by sandhi or by svarita, that is called vakrokti, which is of two kinds.

original: śabdair ekavidhair eva bhāṣāsu vividhāsv api /
analyzed: śabdaiḥ ekavidhaiḥ eva bhāṣāsu vividhāsu api
translated: Where a sentence is the same in various languages using the same words,

original: vākyaṃ yatra bhavet so 'yaṃ bhāṣāsama itīṣyate // / //
analyzed: vākyam yatra bhavet saḥ yam bhāṣā samaḥ iti iṣyate
translated: that is considered to be bhāṣāsaṃa.

analyzed: śliṣṭaiḥ padaiḥ aneka artha abhidhāne śleṣaḥ ucyate
translated: When many meanings are expressed by connected words, it is called yamaka (double entendre).

analyzed: varṇa pratyaya liṅgānām prakṛtyoḥ padayoḥ api
translated: Of letters, endings, genders, roots, affixes, words, and also of cases and numbers,

analyzed: śleṣāt vibhakti vacana bhāṣāṇām aṣṭadhā ca saḥ
translated: Yamaka is of eight kinds due to yamaka of case endings, numbers, and languages.

analyzed: punar tridhā sa bhaṅgaḥ bhaṅgaḥ tad ubhaya ātmakaḥ
translated: It is again of three kinds: with parts, without parts, and having both.

analyzed: padi ādi ākāra hetu tve varṇanām citram ucyate
translated: When letters are the cause of the form of a verse, etc., it is called citra (varied).

original: rasasya paripanthitvān nālaṅkāraū prahelikā // / //🔽uktivaicitryamātraṃ sā cyutadattākṣarādikā /
analyzed: rasasya paripanthi tvāt prahelikā  ukti vaicitrya mātram sā cyutadatta akṣara ādikā
translated: Because it obstructs rasa, it is not an alamkara (ornament) in a riddle.🔽It is mere variety of expression, with missing or added syllables, etc.

original: sāmyaṃ vācyam avaidharmye vākyaikye upamā dvayoḥ // / //
analyzed: sāmyam vācyam avaidharmye vākya aikye upamā dvayoḥ
translated: Similarity is expressed in the absence of dissimilarity, when there is unity of sentence between two.

original: sā pūrṇā yadi sāmānyadharma aupamyavāci ca /
analyzed: sā pūrṇā yadi sāmānya dharma aupamya vāci ca
translated: It is complete if there is a common property and a word expressing similarity.

original: upamānaṃ copameyaṃ bhaved vācyam iyaṃ punaḥ // / //🔽śrautī yathevāvāśabdā ivārtho vā vatir yadi /
analyzed: upamānam ca upameyam bhavet vācyam iyam punar  śrautī yathā iva avā śabdāḥ iva arthaḥ vā vatiḥ yadi
translated: And the standard of comparison and the object compared should be expressed. This is again🔽Verbal when there are words like yathā, iva, vā, or the sense of iva is expressed by the affix vati.

original: ārthī tulyasamānādyās tulyārtho yatra vā vatiḥ // / //
analyzed: ārthī tulya samāna ādyāḥ tulya arthaḥ yatra vā vatiḥ
translated: The sense is of equality, sameness, etc., where vati has the sense of equality.

original: dve taddhite samāse 'pi vākye pūrṇā ṣaḍ eva tat /
analyzed: dve taddhite samāse vākye pūrṇā ṣaṣ eva tat
translated: There are two types of taddhita (secondary suffixes), also in compounds and sentences. There are six types of complete (upamiti).

original: luptā sāmānyadharmāder ekasya yadi vā dvayoḥ // / //
analyzed: luptā sāmānya dharma ādeḥ ekasya yadi vā dvayoḥ
translated: The incomplete one is when one or two of the common properties, etc. are omitted.

original: trayāṇāṃ vānupādāne śrauty ārthī sāpi pūrvavat /
analyzed: trayāṇām vā an upādāne śrautī ārthī sā api pūrvavat
translated: In the absence of three, that based on the Vedic text is also like the previous one.

original: pūrṇāvad dharmalope sā vinā śrautīṃ tu taddhite // / //
analyzed: pūrṇā vat dharma lope sā vinā śrautīm tu taddhite
translated: In the absence of the complete dharma, it is like the full moon, but without the Vedic text in the tatpurusha compound.

analyzed: ādhāra karma vihite dvividhe ca kyaci kyaṅi
translated: In the two types of kyan and kyan, which are formed by the kyan affix in the case of the basis and the object,

original: karmakartror ṇamuli casyād evaṃ pañcadhā punaḥ // / //🔽upamānānupādāne dvidhā vākyasamāsayoḥ /
analyzed: karma kartroḥ ṇamuli ca syāt evam pañcadhā punar  upamāna anupādāne dvidhā vākya samāsayoḥ
translated: and in the case of the nominative and objective affixes, it is of five types again.🔽In the absence of the standard of comparison, it is of two types in the case of a sentence and a compound.

original: aupamyavācino lope samāse kvipi ca dvidhā // / //🔽dvidhā samāse vākye ca lope dharmopamānayoḥ /
analyzed: aupamya vācinaḥ lope samāse kvipi ca dvidhā  dvidhā samāse vākye ca lope dharma upamānayoḥ
translated: In the absence of the word for comparison, it is of two types in the case of a compound and a kvip affix.🔽In the absence of the standard of comparison and the dharma, it is of two types in the case of a compound and a sentence.

analyzed: kvip samāsa gatāḥ dvedhā
translated: In the absence of the standard of comparison and the dharma, it is of two types in the case of a kvip compound and a compound.

original: upameyasya lope tu syād eka pratyaye kyaci /
analyzed: upameyasya lope tu syāt eka pratyaye kyaci
translated: In the absence of the object of comparison, there is a kyan affix with one ending.

analyzed: dharma upameya lope nyā tri lope ca samāsa gā
translated: In the absence of the standard of comparison and the dharma, another is in the case of a compound with three absences.

analyzed: tena upamāyāḥ bhedāḥ syuḥ saptaviṃśati saṅkhyakāḥ
translated: Thus, the types of comparison would be twenty-seven in number.

original: ekarūpaḥ kvacit kvāpi bhinnaḥ sādhāraṇo guṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: eka rūpaḥ kvacid kvāpi bhinnaḥ sādhāraṇaḥ guṇaḥ
translated: The common quality is sometimes of one form, sometimes different.

analyzed: bhinne bimba anubimba tvam śabda mātreṇa vā bhidā
translated: In the case of difference, there is the nature of the original and the reflection, or difference by mere word.
The comparison that extends over a part is understood to be expressed.

analyzed: bhavetām yatra sāmyasya kathitā rasanā upamā
translated: Where there is said to be equality, it is called the comparison of taste.

analyzed: yathā ūrdhvam upameyasya yadi syāt upamāna tā
translated: When there is the state of the object compared in the object compared to, as above,

analyzed: mālā upamā yat ekasya upamānam bahu dṛśyate
translated: The garland simile is when the comparison of one thing is seen to be many.

analyzed: upamāna upameya tvam ekasya eva tu ananvayaḥ
translated: But the state of being compared and compared to of only one thing without connection,

analyzed: paryāyeṇa dvayoḥ etat upameya upamā matā
translated: This is considered to be the simile of the object compared and compared to in turn.

analyzed: sadṛśa anubhavāt vastu smṛtiḥ smaraṇam ucyate
translated: The recollection of an object due to the experience of a similar thing is said to be remembrance.

analyzed: rūpakam rūpita āropāt viṣaye nirapahnave
translated: Metaphor is the superimposition of the metaphorical entity on the object without denial.

original: tat paraṃparitaṃ sāṅgaṃ niraṅgam iti ca tridhā // / //
analyzed: tat paraṃparitam sa aṅgam niraṅgam iti ca tridhā
translated: That is threefold: extended, with parts, and without parts.

analyzed: yatra kasyacid āropaḥ para āropaṇa kāraṇam
translated: Where the superimposition of one thing is the cause of the superimposition of another,

analyzed: tat paraṃparitam prāhuḥ śliṣṭa aśliṣṭa nibandhanam
translated: They call that extended, based on connection or non-connection.

analyzed: pratyekam kevalam mālā rūpakam ca iti caturvidham
translated: It is fourfold: individual, simple, garland-like, and metaphorical.

original: aṅgino yadi sāṅgasya rūpaṇaṃ sāṅgam eva tat // / //
analyzed: aṅginaḥ yadi sa aṅgasya rūpaṇam sa aṅgam eva tat
translated: If there is a metaphor of the whole with its parts, that is with parts.

analyzed: samasta vastu viṣayam eka deśa vivarti ca
translated: It has as its object the whole thing and a part,

analyzed: āropyāṇām aśeṣāṇām śābda tve prathamam matam
translated: The first is considered to be when all the superimposed things are verbal.

analyzed: yatra kasyacid ārtha tvam eka deśa vivarti tat
translated: Where some of them are meant to be understood, that is with a part.

original: niraṅgaṃ kevalasyaiva rūpaṇaṃ tad api dvidhā // / //
analyzed: niraṅgam kevalasya eva rūpaṇam tat api dvidhā
translated: That also is twofold: the metaphor of only the whole without parts.

analyzed: mālā kevala rūpa tvāt tena aṣṭau rūpaka bhedāḥ
translated: Due to the mere form of a garland, there are eight types of metaphor.

original: dṛśyante kvacid āropyāḥ śliṣṭāḥ saṅge 'pi rūpake // / //
analyzed: dṛśyante kvacid āropyāḥ śliṣṭāḥ saṅge pi rūpake
translated: Sometimes the superimposed objects are seen to be connected in metaphor even in connection.

original: adhikārūḍhavaiśiṣṭyaṃ rūpakaṃ yat tad eva tat /
analyzed: adhika ārūḍha vaiśiṣṭyam rūpakam yat tat eva tat
translated: That metaphor which has the superiority mounted on the subject is just that.

analyzed: viṣaya arthatayā āropye prakṛta artha upayogini
translated: When the superimposed object is useful for the primary meaning by being the object,

analyzed: pariṇāmaḥ bhavet tulyā tulya adhikaraṇaḥ dvidhā
translated: There would be a transformation, twofold as equal and unequal in basis.

analyzed: sandehaḥ prakṛte nyasya saṃśayaḥ pratibhā utthitaḥ
translated: Doubt is the arising of doubt about something else in the primary matter, arising from imagination.

original: śuddho niścayagarbhāsau niścayānta iti tridhā /🔽sāmyād atasmiṃs tadbuddhir bhrāntimān pratibhotthitā // / //
analyzed: śuddhaḥ niścaya garbhā asau niścaya antaḥ iti tridhā  sāmyāt a tasmin tad buddhiḥ bhrāntimān pratibhā utthitā
translated: That is threefold: pure, having certainty as its essence, and ending with certainty.🔽The imagination arising from imagination is mistaken, the cognition of that as not being that due to similarity.

original: kvacid bhedād gṛhītṛṇāṃ viṣayāṇāṃ tathā kvacit /
analyzed: kvacid bhedāt gṛhītṛṇām viṣayāṇām tathā kvacid
translated: Sometimes due to difference, of the apprehenders and objects, and sometimes in that way,

analyzed: ekasya anekadhā ullekhaḥ yaḥ saḥ ullekhaḥ ucyate
translated: The manifold representation of one thing is said to be representation.

analyzed: prakṛtam pratiṣidhya anya sthāpanam syāt apahnutiḥ
translated: The denial of the primary matter and the establishment of something else would be denial.

original: gopanīyaṃ kam apy arthaṃ dyotayitvā kathañcana // / //🔽yadi śleṣeṇānyathā vānyathayet sāpy apahnutiḥ /
analyzed: gopanīyam kam api artham dyotayitvā kathaṃcana  yadi śleṣeṇa anyathā vā anyathayet sā api apahnutiḥ
translated: Having somehow indicated some concealed meaning,🔽If it is otherwise by pun or otherwise, that is also denial.

analyzed: anyat niṣidhya prakṛta sthāpanam niścayaḥ punar
translated: The establishment of the primary matter by denying something else is again certainty.

analyzed: bhavet saṃbhāvanā utprekṣā prakṛtasya para ātmanā
translated: It would be an imaginative expression of possibility when the primary thing is imagined to be like another.

original: vācyā pratīyamānā sā prathamaṃ dvividhā matā // / //
analyzed: vācyā pratīyamānā sā prathamam dvividhā matā
translated: That is considered to be of two kinds, expressed and suggested, in the first place.

original: vācye vādeḥ prayoge syād aprayoge parā punaḥ /
analyzed: vācye vā ādeḥ prayoge syāt a prayoge parā punar
translated: In the expressed one, there would be usage of the word, in the unexpressed one, it is again different.

original: jātir guṇaḥ kriyā dravyaṃ yad utprekṣyaṃ dvayor api // / //
analyzed: jātiḥ guṇaḥ kriyā dravyam yat utprekṣyam dvayoḥ api
translated: When either of the two is imagined to be a class, quality, action, or substance,

analyzed: tat aṣṭadhā api pratyekam bhāva abhāva abhimānataḥ
translated: it is of eight kinds, each due to the conception of existence and non-existence.

analyzed: guṇa kriyā sva rūpa tvāt nimittasya punar ca tāḥ
translated: And again, those are of thirty-two kinds due to the nature of the cause being a quality or action,

analyzed: dvātriṃśat vidha tām yānti tatra vācya abhidhāḥ punar
translated: and due to the expressed ones being of thirty-two kinds there.

analyzed: vinā dravyam tridhā sarvāḥ svarūpa phala hetu gāḥ
translated: All of them are of three kinds without substance, going to their own nature, fruit, and cause.

analyzed: ukti anuktyoḥ nimittasya dvidhā tatra sva rūpa gāḥ
translated: There, those going to their own nature are of two kinds, due to the cause being stated or not stated.

analyzed: pratīyamānāḥ bhedāḥ ca pratyekam phala hetu gāḥ
translated: And the suggested varieties are each of two kinds, going to fruit and cause.

original: uktyanuktyoḥ prastutasya pratyekaṃ tā api dvidhā /
analyzed: ukti anuktyoḥ prastutasya pratyekam tāḥ api dvidhā
translated: And those are also of two kinds each, due to the primary thing being stated or not stated.

analyzed: alaṅkāra antara utthā sā vaicitryam adhikam bhajet
translated: That which arises from another ornament would have an abundance of variety.
When there is a conviction of what is accomplished, it is said to be hyperbole.

analyzed: bhede pi abhedaḥ saṃbandhe saṃbandhaḥ tad viparyayau
translated: Even in difference, non-difference; in connection, non-connection; and their opposites.

analyzed: paurvāparya ātmakam kārya hetvoḥ sā pañcadhā mataḥ
translated: That is considered to be of five kinds, consisting of sequence and reverse sequence, of effect and cause.

original: padārthānāṃ prastutānām anyeṣāṃ vā yadā bhavet // / //
analyzed: padārthānām prastutānām anyeṣām vā yadā bhavet
translated: When there is a connection with one attribute of the topics under discussion or others,

analyzed: eka dharma abhisaṃbandhaḥ syāt tadā tulya yogi tā
translated: then there is a simile of equal application.

analyzed: aprastuta prastutayoḥ dīpakam tu nigadyate
translated: But when there is a connection with the unmentioned and the mentioned, it is said to be a pun.

original: atha kārakam ekaṃ syād anekāsu kriyāsu cet /
analyzed: atha kārakam ekam syāt anekāsu kriyāsu ced
translated: If one agent were to be engaged in many actions,

analyzed: prativastūpamā sā syāt vākyayoḥ gamya sāmyayoḥ
translated: that would be a simile based on each individual, when the similarity is understood in two sentences.

original: eko 'pi dharmaḥ sāmānyo yatra nirdiśyate pṛthak /
analyzed: ekaḥ pi dharmaḥ sāmānyaḥ yatra nirdiśyate pṛthak
translated: Where a single common attribute is indicated separately,

analyzed: dṛṣṭāntaḥ tu sadharmasya api vastunaḥ pratibimbanaḥ
translated: but a simile is the reflection of an object having a similar attribute.

analyzed: saṃbhavan saṃbhavan vā api kutracid
translated: Whether the connection with an object is possible or not possible somewhere,

analyzed: yatra bimba anubimba tvam bodhayet sā nidarśanā
translated: where there is the nature of the original and the reflected image, that is an illustration.

analyzed: ādhikyam upameyasya upamānāt nyūna tā athavā
translated: The superiority of the object being compared over the object compared to, or the inferiority of the latter,

original: vyatireka eka ukte 'nukte hetau punas tridhā // / //
analyzed: vyatireke ekaḥ ukte n ukte hetau punar tridhā
translated: is a contrast. When the reason is stated, it is one. When not stated, it is threefold again.

original: caturvidho 'pi sāmyasya bodhanāc chabdato 'rthataḥ /🔽ākṣepāc ca dvādaśadhā śleṣe 'pīti triraṣṭadhā // / //
analyzed: caturvidhaḥ sāmyasya bodhanāt śabdataḥ rthataḥ  ākṣepāt ca dvādaśadhā śleṣe pi iti tris aṣṭadhā
translated: The four kinds are also twelve-fold due to the indication of equality by word and meaning,

analyzed: pratyekam syāt milita aṣṭacatvāriṃśat vidhaḥ punar
translated: and by implication, thus it is eighteen-fold in alliteration as well.🔽Each one again becomes forty-eight-fold when combined.

original: sahārthasya balād ekaṃ yatra syād vācakaṃ dvayoḥ // / //
analyzed: saha arthasya balāt ekam yatra syāt vācakam dvayoḥ
translated: When one expressive word applies to both by the force of the meaning of 'with',

analyzed: sā sahoktiḥ mūla bhūta atiśayoktiḥ yadā bhavet
translated: that is saha-ukti (co-statement), when it becomes the basic hyperbole.

original: vinoktir yad vinānyena nāsādhv anyad asādhu vā // / //🔽samāsoktiḥ samair yatra kāryaliṅgaviśeṣaṇaiḥ /
analyzed: vinā uktiḥ yat vinā anyena na asādhu anyat asādhu vā  samāsoktiḥ samaiḥ yatra kārya liṅga viśeṣaṇaiḥ
translated: Vinokti (dissimilitude) is when one thing is not good without another, or the other is not good without it.🔽Samāsokti (compound statement) is where there is agreement of action, gender, and attributes,

original: vyavahārasamāropaḥ prakṛtenāsya vastunaḥ // / //🔽uktair viśeṣaṇaiḥ sābhiprāyaiḥ parikaro mataḥ /
analyzed: vyavahāra samāropaḥ prakṛtena asya vastunaḥ  uktaiḥ viśeṣaṇaiḥ sa abhiprāyaiḥ parikaraḥ mataḥ
translated: and there is superimposition of usage on this actual thing.🔽Parigraha (embellishment) is considered to be with expressive attributes that have an intention.

analyzed: śabdaiḥ svabhāvāt ekārthe śleṣaḥ na eka artha vācanam
translated: In the same meaning, alliteration is the expression of multiple meanings by words.

original: kvacid viśeṣaḥ sāmānyāt sāmānyaṃ vā viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: kvacid viśeṣaḥ sāmānyāt sāmānyam vā viśeṣataḥ
translated: Sometimes there is particularity from the general, or generality from the particular.

original: kāryān nimittaṃ kāryaṃ ca hetor atha samāt samam // / //
analyzed: kāryāt nimittam kāryam ca hetoḥ atha samāt samam
translated: From the cause, the effect, and the effect from the cause, or the equal from the equal.

original: aprastutāt prastutaṃ ced gamyate pañcadhā tataḥ /
analyzed: aprastutāt prastutam ced gamyate pañcadhā tatas
translated: If the suggested is from the non-relevant, then it is five-fold.

original: aprastutapraśaṃsā syād uktā vyājastutiḥ punaḥ // / //🔽nindāstutibhyāṃ vācyābhyāṃ gamyatve stutinindayoḥ /
analyzed: aprastuta praśaṃsā syāt uktā vyāja stutiḥ punar  nindā stutibhyām vācyābhyām gamya tve stuti nindayoḥ
translated: Prastāvanā is said to be the introduction of a topic.🔽When praise and blame, which are to be expressed by means of praise and blame, are implied,

analyzed: paryāya uktam yadā bhaṅgyā gamyam evā abhidhīyate
translated: Paryāyokta is when what is to be understood by implication is actually stated.

original: sāmānyaṃ vā viśeṣeṇa viśeṣas tena vā yadi /
analyzed: sāmānyam vā viśeṣeṇa viśeṣaḥ tena vā yadi
translated: When a general statement is qualified by a particular, or a particular is qualified by a general,

original: kāryaṃ ca kāraṇenedaṃ kāryeṇa ca samarthyate // / //
analyzed: kāryam ca kāraṇena idam kāryeṇa ca samarthyate
translated: This is called Kāryakāraṇabhāva when a cause is qualified by an effect, or an effect is qualified by a cause.

analyzed: sādharmyena itareṇa artha antara nyāsaḥ ṣṭadhā tatas
translated: Arthāntaranyāsa is of eight kinds by means of other similarities, based on those.

analyzed: hetoḥ vākya padārtha tve kāvya liṅgaḥ nigadyate
translated: When the reason is the meaning of a sentence or a word, it is called Kāvyaliṅga.

original: anumānaṃ tu vicchityā jñānaṃ sādhyasya sādhanāt /
analyzed: anumānam tu vicchityā jñānam sādhyasya sādhanāt
translated: Anumāna is the knowledge of the probandum from the probans.

analyzed: abhedena abhidhā hetuḥ hetoḥ hetumatā saha
translated: When there is non-difference between the probans and the probandum, it is called Hetu.

analyzed: anukūlam prātikūlyam anukūla vidhāyi ced
translated: If the unfavourable is favourable, when the unfavourable is made favourable,

original: vastuno vaktum iṣṭasya viśeṣapratipattaye // / //🔽niṣedhābhāsa ākṣepo vakṣyamāṇoktago dvidhā /
analyzed: vastunaḥ vaktum iṣṭasya viśeṣa pratipattaye  niṣedha ābhāsaḥ ākṣepaḥ vakṣyamāṇa ukta gaḥ dvidhā
translated: For the purpose of understanding the particular of the desired object,🔽Ākṣepa is the appearance of negation, which will be described as twofold, referring to what is to be stated and what is stated.

analyzed: aniṣṭasya tathā arthasya vidhi ābhāsaḥ paraḥ mataḥ
translated: The other is considered to be the appearance of affirmation of the undesirable object.

original: vibhāvanā vinā hetuṃ kāryotpattir yad ucyate /
analyzed: vibhāvanā vinā hetum kārya utpattiḥ yat ucyate
translated: Vibhāvanā is said to be the production of an effect without a cause.

analyzed: ukta anukta nimitta tvāt dvidhā sā parikīrtitā

analyzed: kārya kāraṇayoḥ bhinna deśa tāyām asaṅgatiḥ  guṇau kriye vā yat syātām viruddhe hetu kāryayoḥ

analyzed: yat ādheyam an ādhāram ekam ca aneka gocaram

analyzed: kiñcid prakurvataḥ kāryam aśakyasya itarasya vā

analyzed: parisaṅkhyā uttaram praśnasya uttarāt unnayaḥ yadi

analyzed: vikalpaḥ tulya balayoḥ virodhaḥ ca antarāyataḥ

analyzed: samuccayaḥ yam ekasmin sati kāryasya sādhake

analyzed: khalekapotikā nyāyāt tad karaḥ tad paraḥ ced

analyzed: prasiddhasya upamānasya upameya tva prakalpanam
translated: The designation of a well-known object as the object of comparison,

analyzed: uktvā ca atyantam utkarṣam ati utkṛṣṭasya vastunaḥ
translated: Having described the extremely superior nature of an extremely excellent object,

analyzed: kalpite pi upamāna tve pratīpam kecid ūcire

analyzed: mīlitam vastunaḥ guptiḥ kenacid tulya lakṣmaṇā

analyzed: sāmānyam prakṛtasya anya tādātmyam sadṛśaiḥ guṇaiḥ

Tadguṇa is the acceptance of an extremely excellent quality by abandoning one's own quality.

original: adbhutasya padārthasya bhūtasyārthe bhaviṣyataḥ /🔽yat pratyakṣāyamānatvaṃ tad bhāvikam udāhṛtam // / //

analyzed: loka atiśaya saṃpattiḥ vastunā udāttam ucyate
